meanings.definition: The time or date when the sun crosses the celestial equator, making night and day of approximately equal length all over the earth.
meanings.sent1: During the equinox, day and night are almost the same length.
meanings.sent2: People celebrate the equinox because it marks the start of spring.
meanings.sent3: At the equinox, even the sun and moon take turns shining.
meanings.sent4: The equinox is like a seesaw, balancing light and darkness.
meanings.sent5: The equinox paints the sky with a perfect blend of day and night.

meanings.definition: A state of perfect balance between opposing forces or influences.
meanings.sent1: In nature, the equinox represents harmony between different elements.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together in equinox to achieve their goal.
meanings.sent3: The equinox of opinions led to a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an equinox of conflicting emotions.
meanings.sent5: The equinox of power and humility made him a great leader.
